text: What is the difference between a lit shader and an unlit shader? Select one answer.

options.text: A lit shader allows you to add emissive light to an object, so that it can appear to light up. An unlit shader does not, but using unlit shaders increases performance.
A lit shader only works with the Universal Render Pipeline. Other render pipelines use unlit shaders.
A lit shader adds shadows and reflections according to the light that reaches the object. An unlit shader ignores the effects of light.

feedbackCorrect: Lit shaders respond to the light in the scene, and unlit shaders donâ€™t. Unlit shaders are useful for certain artistic effects or for optimized projects that run more efficiently by not using lighting.
